intro: Hieracium oramnodes, commonly known as the yellow hawkweed, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its bright yellow flowers, which are typically arranged in a single head and surrounded by leaf-like bracts. The plant has a rosette of basal leaves that are usually hairy and have a rough texture. It thrives in disturbed soils and can be found in meadows, roadsides, and other open areas. Hieracium oramnodes is known for its ability to spread through both seeds and rhizomes, making it a persistent weed in many regions.
